page.title: 10Mitcham Common Factory 2
page.content: When Hoopers gave the rubber works up the Wood Family took over to make Woodite a rubber like elastic coating. In 1927 the Wood Family sold the whole site to Samuel Ward & Co.the paint and varnish manufacturers.In 1966 S & R.J. Everett owned all the premises.They processed and callibrated hypodermic syringes,needles and components.Now the factory is split into 6 units. {STRAKER}have got unit 1.They make office supplies.{DRG}have got unit 2. They sell stationery.They employ 30 people.{SWISSTONE ELECTRONIC LTD.}have got unit 3. {CIRCOLEC THE ELECTRONIC {SERVICE}have got unit 4.{STC}have got unit 5.{STC}make marine equipment, Telex Typewriters and Telephone equipment.They employ about 150 people.Lastly,{SPIERS & ROLFE}have got unit 6. They do colour printing and they employ about 15 people.
